intro: Tribulocarpus dimorphanthus, commonly known as the two-seeded tribulus, is a flowering plant native to South Africa. It belongs to the family Zygophyllaceae and is characterized by its distinctive two-seeded fruits. The plant typically grows in arid or semi-arid environments, showcasing its adaptability to harsh conditions. Its leaves are often trifoliate, and it produces small, yellowish flowers. The species is of interest in botanical studies due to its unique morphology and ecological significance.
